Class Memory 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----Memory
public class Memory
extends Object
Memory Class - Simulation of a computers main memory

Version:
09.10.1998, 12.06.1998
Author:
Ken Schulz

freeBlock
mem
MEMSIZE

Memory()
Default Constructor initializes memory with 30 blocks.

allocate()
allocate returns the block number of a newly allocated memory block returns -1 if none available
deallocate(int)
deallocate sends sepcfied block back into the abyss of reusable memory
dump(int)
Dump the contents of memory to the Trace File...
getFreeBlock()
getFreeBlock returns the lowest available free block returns -1 if none available
getFreeBlocks()
getFreeBlocks return the number of blocks that are free in memory
isFree(int)
isFree returns true if the block is free
isFull()
isFull returns boolean true if memory is full
readBlock(int)
readBlock returns the indicated block as an array of strings
readWord(int)
readWord returns the indicated word as a string
writeBlock(int, String[])
writeBlock writes given information to a specific block of memory NOTE: This method must take in a string array of 10 Elements!!!
writeWord(int, String)
writeWord writes given information to a specific word in memory

mem 
 protected String mem[]
freeBlock 
 protected boolean freeBlock[]
MEMSIZE 
 protected static final int MEMSIZE

Memory 
 public Memory()
Default Constructor initializes memory with 30 blocks. 1 Block = 10 Words 1 Word = 4 Bytes Each word is a element in the mem array Memory consists of 30 Blocks = 300 Words = 1200 Bytes

readBlock 
 public String[] readBlock(int blockNumber)
readBlock returns the indicated block as an array of strings

Parameters:
blockNumber - is the index of mem that will be returned
Returns:
An array of words which equals a block (10 Words)
writeBlock 
 public void writeBlock(int blockNumber,
                        String newBlock[])
writeBlock writes given information to a specific block of memory NOTE: This method must take in a string array of 10 Elements!!!

Parameters:
blockNumber - is the index of mem that the data will be writen to
newBlock - is the new block that will be set at index blockNumber
Returns:
void
readWord 
 public String readWord(int wordNumber)
readWord returns the indicated word as a string

Parameters:
wordNumber - is the index of mem that will be returned
Returns:
A String which is a 4 Byte Word
writeWord 
 public void writeWord(int wordNumber,
                       String newWord)
writeWord writes given information to a specific word in memory

Parameters:
wordNumber - is the index of mem that the data will be writen to
newWord - is the new word that will be set at index wordNumber
Returns:
void
allocate 
 public int allocate()
allocate returns the block number of a newly allocated memory block returns -1 if none available

Returns:
int of allocated block
deallocate 
 public void deallocate(int freeBlockNumber)
deallocate sends sepcfied block back into the abyss of reusable memory

Parameters:
freeBlockNumber - is the block number that will be released to the wild
Returns:
void
getFreeBlock 
 public int getFreeBlock()
getFreeBlock returns the lowest available free block returns -1 if none available

Returns:
int of free block
isFree 
 public boolean isFree(int blockNumber)
isFree returns true if the block is free

Parameters:
blockNumber - is the track number to be checked
Returns:
boolean status that will be checked for free status
isFull 
 public boolean isFull()
isFull returns boolean true if memory is full

Returns:
true if memory is full
getFreeBlocks 
 public int getFreeBlocks()
getFreeBlocks return the number of blocks that are free in memory

Returns:
number of free blocks
dump 
 public void dump(int n)
Dump the contents of memory to the Trace File...

Parameters:
n - Dump memory 0 to n...
